terms.definition: A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to view revision history and revert to previous versions when needed.
A single, unified location where all project documents are stored, organized, and made accessible to authorized team members.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
A centralized location where all authoritative and up-to-date information is stored, ensuring everyone accesses the same accurate data.
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously edit, comment on, and review documents with changes visible instantly to all participants.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents, providing accountability and compliance tracking.
The capability of software to create, manage, and display content in multiple languages for global team collaboration.
Application Programming Interface - a set of protocols and tools that allow different software applications to communicate and share data with each other.
A software interface designed to work seamlessly across mobile devices, providing full functionality on smartphones and tablets.
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software systems that manage and automate core business processes across an organization.
The process of coordinating and aligning different work processes and tools to ensure seamless data flow and task management.
The practice of assigning keywords or labels to documents to improve organization, searchability, and categorization.
The systematic monitoring and documentation of adherence to industry standards, regulations, and legal requirements.
The process of connecting different software tools and systems to work together seamlessly, sharing data and functionality.
